description: {"blocks":[{"key":"56dk3","text":"This protocol describes the steps required for successful implantation of small cell neuroendocrine prostate cancer patient-derived xenograft (PDX) cells in the liver. Liver is one of the most common sites for development of metastatic prostate cancer and its study is important for evaluating the tumor characteristics and response to therapy.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3j653","text":"This protocol can be used for implantation of any tumor cell line in the liver. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1j4c6","text":"Preparation of surgical instruments and supplies: All of the instruments and supplies should be sterilized. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":50}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3u077","text":"Preparation of the PDX cells for implantation ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":46}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a4skt","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"eldv7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":47,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"af499","text":"Preparation of fresh PDX cells for implantation","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b444s","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9uu4j","text":"Note: Follow the steps till step number 24 from the following protocol to prepare single-cell digestion from fresh tumor tissue: (dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.bvrun56w)","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Preparation of cells for implantation from frozen biobank
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"sc7d","text":"Retrieve cryovials containing cells from liquid nitrogen storage. Thaw the cell-containing cryovial by placing it in 37 degrees water bath. Move the vial into a BSL2 hood and transfer the contents of the vial in a 15 ml conical tube containing fresh DMEM media (  DMEM per   of the cell mixture) and mix gently. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":262,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":273,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3vlor","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c6199","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9kqh7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"doajk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"9","error":false,"guid":"B8C126201BD611EC9C13FD29F9C6177F","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"C25BCC301BD611EC9C13FD29F9C6177F","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

steps.section: Preparation of cells for implantation from frozen biobank
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5gpt","text":"Centrifuge the 15 ml tube containing cells at    and aspirate the supernatant. Resuspend the cells in fresh DMEM to a final concentration of 1M live cells/10-20 ul and transfer this mixture into an eppendorf tube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":46,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"20pb5","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5ghtg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"etp4t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"","data":{"centrifuge":"300","duration":0,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"9DEA8920103411ECBD0BB7ACC399BED5","id":0,"label":"5 mins","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1jlmb","text":"Keep the eppendorf tube on ice for the remainder of the procedure. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Preparation of cells for implantation from frozen biobank
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"depvi","text":"Transfer the cell suspension into a syringe right before beginning the surgery. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"53rh0","text":"Station 1: Fur removal","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4rqa9","text":"","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ccp8m","text":"","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1b3i9","text":"  ","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8m72o","text":"","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ouh","text":"","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"EEB3CE33CB0811EB9FD90A58A9FEAC02","height":210,"id":189318,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"d0kst","text":"Station 1, Fur removal station with anesthesia tubing and nose cone, clippers for hair removal, sterile cotton tips for removal of left-over fur and kimwipe for cleaning. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f26ibkkvx.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f26gbkkvx.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f26hbkkvx.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f26fbkkvx.webp","width":235}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"29lh9","text":"Place a disposable sterile pad on a heating pad. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1vc0m","text":"Aseptically sterilize the surgical area by spraying with 70% ethanol. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7jjm9","text":"Station 2: Surgery","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"adb9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8958n","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"036C82C3CB0911EB9FD90A58A9FEAC02","height":528,"id":189322,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7tooo","text":"Station 2, Surgery station with 1) sterilized surgery instruments, 2) sterile dissolvable sutures, 3) lidocaine and 4) buprenorphine, 5) 70% ethanol prep pad, 6) povidone-Iodine prep pads, 7) disposable sterile pad, 8) eye ointment, 9) sterile cotton tipped applicators, 10) ice box with ice, 11) syringe on ice for intrahepatic injection of cells, 12) eppendorf tube containing cell suspension, 13) weighing scale, 14) kimwipes, 15) bead sterilizer and 16) nose cone and bain tubing. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f26nbkkvx.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f26kbkkvx.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f26mbkkvx.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f26jbkkvx.webp","width":550}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"oqli","text":"Place a disposable sterile pad on a heating pad. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"co12j","text":"Aseptically sterilize the surgical area by spraying with 70% ethanol. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"43p63","text":"Place all the autoclaved surgical instruments within the sterilized surgical area.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9ji21","text":"Place the animal in a knock-down box circulating with a gas mixture of Isoflurane @ 1.4-2.0% and O2 @ 1-1.2 lt/min inhalant, maintained via a bain-closed system. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":98,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ck54n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7knbe","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"682cd","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7jc6q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":6,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"80a2f","text":"Heat: Animal should be kept on a heating pad or circulating water blanket/pad during the entire procedure and, until the animal has fully recovered from anesthesia/is mobile","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5ukqj","text":"Note the start time for anesthesia.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"56v0r","text":"Move the animal to the station 1 nose cone and apply ophthalmic ointment on the animal’s eyes to prevent them from drying out during the procedure. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5iqbj","text":"Determine the anesthetic depth by pinching the animal’s foot for a reflex response. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"77c4n","text":"Depilate the ventral side to remove fur from the abdomen. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3sdim","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5b72a","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"akk5g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"7C428310CB0911EBB13DFBA21545FB93","height":819,"id":189326,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f26sbkkvx.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f26qbkkvx.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f26rbkkvx.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f26pbkkvx.webp","width":419}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ed8s0","text":"The animal is now ready to be moved to station 2 for surgery. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a7i96","text":"Gently grab the skin with iris forceps 1 cm under the xiphoid process and make a small (1–2 cm) vertical incision using dissecting scissors in the skin, perpendicular to the linea alba. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dbjjf","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b1g9n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"CCDE5880CB0911EBB13DFBA21545FB93","height":616,"id":189330,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f26wbkkvx.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f26ubkkvx.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f26vbkkvx.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f26tbkkvx.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ai6ct","text":"Gently grab the peritoneum muscle layer and make an incision to expose the liver. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dare","text":"Pull the muscle layer with iris forceps to adequately expose the liver for needle access. Two hemostats instead of forceps can be used to hold both sides of the muscle layer apart. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9k6mg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bplsr","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1idvb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"072C0910CB0A11EBB13DFBA21545FB93","height":794,"id":189334,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f262bkkvx.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f26ybkkvx.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f26zbkkvx.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f26xbkkvx.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fr0ak","text":"Transfer the cell suspension into a 1 cc syringe with a 27 G needle. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1vbs5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5jl70","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"65te1","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1qm9h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"148kl","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"feho2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7bqvs","text":"Do not leave the liver exposed for too long. This step should be completed in less than 30 secs. Alternatively, cells can be transferred into the syringe before step 13. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"10pff","text":"When the cells are in the syringe, especially if you are injecting multiple mice, you must make sure the cells are resuspended and not settled to the bottom of the syringe each time you inject to inject the correct number of cells per mouse. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bq5rv","text":"While keeping the liver in view with forceps or hemostats, puncture the liver with the pre-loaded syringe and advance the needle a few millimeters along the subcapsular place.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bvnof","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2dbvp","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e0eq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"3E9A6770CB0A11EBB13DFBA21545FB93","height":775,"id":189338,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f266bkkvx.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f264bkkvx.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f265bkkvx.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f263bkkvx.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eo9oq","text":"Inject 10-20 ul of cells suspension from the syringe into the liver. Hold the syringe in place for 20-30 secs to minimize any leakage of cells from the liver. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fu89i","text":"Pull the needle slowly while applying pressure with sterile cotton-tipped applicators in order to minimize leakage of the cells. The injection site should turn white upon successful injection. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fk12j","text":"Using absorbable sutures, suture the muscle layer and then suture the outer skin layer of the incision site. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f81ee","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dvilv","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1gq9m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"91506A50CB0A11EBB13DFBA21545FB93","height":789,"id":189342,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f27abkkvx.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f268bkkvx.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f269bkkvx.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f267bkkvx.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dmbh7","text":"Upon completion of the sutures administer buprenorphine and lidocaine subcutaneously. Note the time of administration. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f1npo","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"44l4h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6hgun","text":"The concentration of lidocaine and buprenorphine should be kept as mentioned in the institute's IACUC protocol. For this protocol, 0.5% v/v solution of lidocaine was administered. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1c2ta","text":"Sterilize the surgical instruments using the bead sterilizer by placing them inside for ~ 10 secs. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"fvkrv","text":"Start prepping the next mouse for surgery.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aco72","text":"Place the animal in a clean cage on a warm heating pad to aid in regaining its body temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3alco","text":"Observe the animal until it has regained full consciousness and is walking around in the cage.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7k0i1","text":"Observe the animal on a daily basis until sacrificed as per your IACUC guidelines.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparation of cells for implantation from frozen biobank
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3m7mq","text":"Prepare DMEM medium: Prepare fresh DMEM media supplemented with ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6mm3b","text":"  FBS and ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1dii0","text":"  Gentamicin. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6if1e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ams02","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"","data":{"concentration":"10","error_concentration":false,"guid":"E60ABE50517511EC8494F9DA6E8CA101","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":14}},"1":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"","data":{"concentration":"100","error_concentration":false,"guid":"F850C870517511EC8494F9DA6E8CA101","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1813}}}}

steps.section: Preparation of cells for implantation from frozen biobank
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1ovq0","text":"Perform live/dead assay using trypan blue and note the live and total cell count. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"chv64","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"mei2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"91u84","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"987kl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bv46e","text":"Disinfect the surgical area by rubbing the area in a circular motion with a povidone-Iodine prep pad followed by a 70% alcohol pad. Repeat this process 2 more times. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Intrahepatic implantation of tumor cells
